intro: Comolia montana, commonly known as mountain comolia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a smooth texture and a slightly hairy underside. Comolia montana is often found in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight.
